column1: A urinary catheter is a small, soft tube placed in the bladder.

Babies can have low urine because they: - Have low blood pressure - Have an abnormally developed urinary system - Take medicines that will not allow them to move their muscles, such as when a child is on a ventilator When your baby has a catheter, doctors and nurses can measure how much urine is coming out.
The urethra is the opening at the tip of the penis in boys and near the vagina in girls.
- If a Foley catheter is used, there is a very small balloon on the end of the catheter in the bladder.
